result.execSummary:
Kayla M. Pavlovich was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Kayla M. Pavlovich was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla M. Pavlovich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: signed by Judge Mary K. Wagner for Judge Chad Kerkman.  Def. will waive any time limits re her extradition to the state of Idaho.  Def. will be held in the Kenosha Co. Jail until Kenosha Co. court files 15-CF-288 and 15-CF-735 are completed.  Def. agrees she may be transported, if a writ has been properly prepared, to Racine Co. for any pending court action in that county.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
DE waives extradition and elects to return to Bonner County, ID and signs waiver of extradition.  Court grants extradition and signs order.  Parties requests extradition not occur until after her sentencing on 9/18/15 at 11:30 AM in 15CF735/15CF288; so ordered by the court.

1:38 pm    Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk:  NJ.  Refetted to Br. 8 for further dipsosition on 8-13-15 @ 8:30.  Fugitive warrant.  $100,000 cash bond set.  DE will waive extradition.
and witness list filed by the State
